Meanwhile, new junior pathologist Harry Cunningham faces a trying time when he finds out his first autopsy will be performed on a child

Then he gets a blast from the past when his own estranged, crack-addicted daughter Amy is found and brought in for questioning. But it soon becomes clear none of these loose ends will ever be tied when the dodgy sergeant answers a seemingly routine callout to a suspect package - only to fall victim to a drive-by shooting. But who pulled the trigger - and why?

With Kim Hartman (Helga in 'Allo, 'Allo)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers is at Wallyford recycling centre on Scotland's east coast hoping to uncover three lucrative items amongst the skip-bound trash. He enlists the help of sign-writer Joel Poole to repurpose some rusty saws, while designer Nicky Cash tries to come up with a creative redesign for an unwanted dressing table and mirror. Meanwhile, JJ sets himself the challenge of transforming a broken-up wooden playhouse

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin help a couple who have £650,000 budget to find a home in Devon, wanting to be close to the coast. Away from the search, he also visits Beer, a picturesque fishing village long associated with smugglers, where he tries not to disturb the residents of the local caves

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Riya and Nanda have a sad and unloved garden in Groby, Leicestershire, with an outdated pink and yellow 'Battenburg' patio, a tumble down shed and a huge gravel slope. This really is a plot that needs to be rescued, especially as Riya is soon to be married and they are hoping to host some of the celebrations in the garden. Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam offer expert advice, which involves picking up on the reds and golds of Riya's wedding colours in the planting

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: DIY legend Tommy Walsh, expert cleaner Maxine Dwyer and carpenter Asher Edwards head to north London to help grandmother Maura make over her messy lounge. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they build a birdwatching area for her grandchildren, fix the unsafe stairs and give the living room a new identity by creating a multi-purpose family space

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda is shocked when Elaine's fiancé, George Knight, and his daughters Anna and Gina arrive from Marbella with plans to help run The Vic. Jack and Phil recognise him as a championship boxer and Nish learns very quickly that he is not to be messed with. Bobby is immediately smitten with the Knight girls but things go wrong for them when they try to lift the mood at The Vic

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 19th MasterChef champion

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.title: King of Thieves (2018)
programme.desc: A thief pulls together a band of misfit criminals to plot the biggest bank heist in British history. The crooks manage to escape with around £200million worth of stolen jewels and money, but when police are called to the scene and the investigation starts, the cracks between the eccentric gang members begin to show, as they row over how to share the goods and become increasingly distrustful of each other. Crime drama based on the Hatton Garden heist, starring Michael Caine, Michael Gambon, Francesca Annis, Jim Broadbent, Ray Winstone and Tom Courtenay

programme.title: Morning Live

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon examine the online reviews that may not be all they appear and offer advice on spotting the real from the fake. Plus, travel expert Simon Calder shares tips, advice and insights

programme.title: Fraud Squad
programme.desc: The conwoman who ripped off multiple public bodies to the tune of £1million. Plus, a supposedly upstanding volunteer suspected of stealing from a pre-school. Presented by Michelle Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow progress on a four-year project to convert a police station in Lancashire, and properties in Nottinghamshire and South Yorkshire are also sold

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Goodfellow turns to Father Brown when he witnesses Mallory frame an innocent man. Mark Williams and John Burton star in the mystery drama, based on the stories by GK Chesterton

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Presenter Jay Blades enlists the help of designer Sarah Peterson to give two side tables a stylish new look, while lighting expert Duncan McKean attempts to give two old record players a radical overhaul. For his own project, Jay attempts to make some money for nothing from two farmhouse stools. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a young couple wanting to swap town life in Halifax, West Yorkshire, for country life in the surroundings of North Yorkshire. Taking a break from the properties, Sonali visits one of the largest farm shops in the UK, where she discovers from its customers and staff just what they think sets it apart from the supermarket chains

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Debra from Wigan, Greater Manchester, wants her new build plot to be transformed into a calming zen garden for relaxation and contemplation. She'd also like it to be low maintenance and maximise the views from the woodland beyond. Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill try to bring her vision to life on a budget of £6,000

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Costume designer Ploy's three-story home is bursting at the seams with designs spilling into every room, preventing her from getting a good night's sleep. ostume designer Ploy's three-story home is bursting at the seams with designs spilling into every room, preventing her from getting a good night's sleep. DIY legend Tommy Walsh, expert cleaner Maxine Dwyer and carpenter Asher Edwards have just 24 hours on a limited budget to organise her space, create a bespoke craft area, and clear the chaos from the conservatory

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Ria Lina joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Cage fighting pro Stevie 'Braveheart' Ray is just one fight away from becoming Scotland's first world champion. This documentary captures the all-or-nothing tale of the lead-up to a major prize fight - and the aftermath - as told through the eyes of his wife Natalie, a 30-year-old mother of four. The PFL world championship is staged in Madison Square Gardens, New York, and the top prize is a million dollars. However, MMA can be dangerous, with fighters having only a pair of 4oz gloves for protection. Both physical pain and mental health are factors to be considered

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Arsenal goalkeeper Jens Lehmann, British gymnastics great Beth Tweddle, seven-time snooker world champion Stephen Hendry and BBC sports presenter JJ Chalmers join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Michelle Visage and Henning Wehn join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty hosts as comedian Hugh Dennis and Conservative peer Ruth Davidson join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of the news

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Gang member Tevin grows suspicious of Dom and Kay after following them to Hackney police station. Posing as volunteer visitors, the undercover duo set about investigating Riverford Residential Home, suspecting it could be a front for the Brightmarsh Gang. Dom makes an unlikely elderly ally and Kay's commitment to community service finally pays dividends. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie are joined by star guests including First Dates' real-life Cupid Fred Sirieix and fiancée Fruitcake to poke fun at life. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Angie, Vince and Rosa receive unwanted Mother's Day surprises, while Oly and Santi are faced with a reality they aren't ready for. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Oly's white lie blows up in her face, and Bowie offers a surprising insight into his parents' lives. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Eastern Promises (2007)
programme.desc: A midwife trying to locate the remaining family of a baby, whose unidentified teenage mother died in childbirth, unwittingly stumbles into a violent underworld of corruption and people-trafficking among London's Russian immigrant population. David Cronenberg's gangster thriller, starring Naomi Watts, Viggo Mortensen and Vincent Cassel

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey across the vast and beautiful Morecambe Bay, where he joins one of the town's last shrimpers to find out how potted shrimp is made, From there, Michael makes his way to Arnside on the Furness Line, where he discovers a magnificently quirky 17th century garden, and across the Arnside viaduct, he reaches Cartmel and its 12th century priory and a Michelin-starred restaurant

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Janine from Merthyr Tydfil calls in the Garden Rescue team to help her create a wildlife friendly garden in the bare and boring new build plot she has with a budget of just £5,000

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team head to Chelmsford to help a family of four who are overwhelmed by their home. They have 24 hours and a minimal budget to transform and clean their neglected house

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Five years ago, Gregg Wallace visited a North Yorkshire food factory to find out how they made their popular sausages. Now he is back to learn the secret of the vegan variety, and discovers the process is surprisingly space age. Cherry Healey learns how Canadian soybeans are transformed into protein-packed tofu and historian Ruth Goodman uncovers the green shoots of the vegetarian movement in Britain

programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: The chef explores the west coast of Scotland, discovering why the sheltered lochs are the perfect environment for langoustines to thrive and why Highland beef is lean and full of flavour. On his journey he prepares deep-fried langoustines and mussels in a vodka and tonic batter, and a Thai-style Highland beef salad

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Jules Hudson goes 'champing' - which is camping in a church - and James Martin shows how to cook a chicken dish on the barbecue. Chris Packham and Megan McCubbin get a special sighting of a flock of kites

programme.title: What Britain Buys and Sells in a Day
programme.desc: As the nation's trading relationships face their biggest change in decades, Ed Balls, Ade Adepitan and Cherry Healey explore the science and systems that enable Britain to import and export goods around the world on an unprecedented scale. Ed is at the London Gateway port to reveal all the tricks of the fruit and vegetable trade, Ade visits Peru to see how Britain's obsession with healthy eating has created a booming economy for avocado growers, and Cherry meets a British farmer keeping the Middle East supplied with apples

programme.title: Back in Time for...
programme.desc: Billy Bragg pays the Arderns a visit as they get to grips with 1960s life. The new decade brings a dizzying number of new developments, including skiffle music, hula hoops and sliced bread. It also brought about a seismic change in shopping with the introduction of self-service. The rise of supermarkets sees the personal service of the Arderns' shop under threat, forcing them to diversify their stock. The 1960s saw Sheffield becoming home to new workers from across the Commonwealth, many of whom share their memories of the era and the importance of the local corner shop to shift workers

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: A collection of some of the best, unseen finds from the series, visiting the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, the National Maritime Museum Cornwall in Falmouth, and the RAF museum in Hendon, London. Items include an art nouveau necklace and a pair of British railway lamps

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Edith Bowman, Fern Brady, Will Kirk and Martin Lewis test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in the North Yorkshire seaside resort of Scarborough to explore one of the greatest royal fortresses in England

programme.title: Digging for Britain: The Greatest Discoveries
programme.desc: Alice Roberts re-examines the key archaeological sites of Iron Age Britain, from an incredible chariot burial in Yorkshire to a vast coin hoard on Jersey

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers evidence of the German occupation of the Jersey village of Gorey and the role it played in defending the UK. He meets local historian Phillip Marett, who takes him to the gun tower from where the occupying soldiers could have watched the Battle of Normandy, and hears a first-hand recollection of the liberation of the island

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan have overnight news of the key characters being followed in this year's show. Iolo Williams goes in search of some of the heathland's resplendent inverts, and Gillian Burke continues her exploration of Snowdonia, looking for the UK's only venomous snake, the adder. Plus, the 81-year-old who has dedicated a decade to building boxes for swifts

programme.title: The Gallows Pole
programme.desc: Shane Meadows drama, based on the book by Benjamin Myers, inspired by the rise of the Cragg Vale Coiners, a gang of counterfeiters in 18th-century Yorkshire. David Hartley returns to his family's moor-top dwelling after seven years in Birmingham. The area has declined in the time he has been away and while he is broken physically, he now has cash, and is determined to change his community for the better. Starring Michael Socha, Thomas Turgoose and Sophie McShera

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: It is the night of Aks's prom, but Mobeen must decide whether to let her go, following rumours about the debauchery at previous proms and the threat of a stabbing

programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.desc: The BBC's world affairs editor reflects on the week's major global news stories, talking to local experts from around the world to go behind the headlines

programme.title: The Death of Stalin (2017)
programme.desc: The place is Moscow, the year is 1953 and after being in power for nearly 30 years, Soviet dictator Joseph Stalin dies after an inconveniently brief illness. Amid the shock, the members of the Council of Ministers engage in a chaotic bid for power. Armando Iannucci's political satire, starring Andrea Riseborough, Jason Isaacs, Rupert Friend, Simon Russell Beale, Steve Buscemi, Jeffrey Tambor and Michael Palin

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville hear from tenants living with damp, mould and a rat infestation under Britain's biggest housing association. Plus, the difference in recycling rules across counties

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: After several gruelling challenges, Gordon knows that all his finalists have what it takes to partner up with him. It's now time to drill down on their businesses and find out whose product is worthy of his endorsement. Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a £150,000 investment

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace bring knockout week to an end by challenging the 10 remaining cooks to serve up a dish that they can eat with their hands. The stakes are high because two of the hopefuls will be going home, leaving the other eight to move on to semi-final week

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels though Cumbria, setting sail in a small craft on Lake Windermere with a lifelong devotee of Arthur Ransome's children's books Swallows and Amazons. At Barrow-in-Furness, Michael investigates the mountains of scrap left behind as iron ore was turned into ships, trains and railway tracks, and discovers researchers are exploring how slagbanks could contribute to reducing atmospheric carbon dioxide.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Eleanor and Rob from Hereford ask the team to help them make an eco-friendly garden for themselves and their two daughters to enjoy using recycled materials and a budget of £4,500

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team are in London to help a single mum of three reclaim her bedroom and get her young daughters back in their own beds

programme.title: A Special School
programme.desc: The summer term kicks off with a massive water fight, then after months of rehearsing, it's finally time to take to the stage with the big show and the actors try to control their nerves about holding hands and singing. The school takes pupils and families to a funfair and holds a prom featuring axe throwing, while parents reflect on the support that the school offers

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A gang stealing catalytic converters pick the wrong street to steal from. A takeaway owner faces a gunman and police hunting a fugitive get unexpected help from a herd of cows

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: The chef travels to the flatlands of Lincolnshire to explore why the region is famed for its pork and how it has the ideal environment for the mass production of peas. Along the way, he cooks succulent pork chops with apple sauce and crispy cabbage, and steamed plaice with peas in their pods, asparagus and bacon

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain learns all about garlic and shows how to make a delicious garlic dressing, Arit Anderson gets a tour of landscape designer Dan Pearson's private garden, and Chris Packham and Megan McCubbin share a special encounter with dolphins. Presented by Gethin Jones

programme.title: What Britain Buys and Sells in a Day
programme.desc: The team looks at the seafood trade, with Ed Balls finding out how the cargo hub at Heathrow is a crucial link in Britain's supply chain and going behind the scenes of the airport operations centre to witness how delays can affect it. Cherry Healey is in the Highlands to find out why the world is so fond of salmon farmed there and fishes for langoustine on Loch Fyne, while Ade Adepitan travels to Iceland to catch one of Britain's favourite type of fish and unravels the story of the Cod Wars

programme.title: Back in Time for...
programme.desc: The Arderns adjust to 1970s life, a time when supermarkets had become Britain's shopping destination of choice and corner shops were beginning to feel the pinch. The family's experience begins with a grand opening designed to compete against the onslaught of the supermarkets. While Sam dons his chicken costume to drum up trade for the shop's 'cheap cheap' prices, the Lord Mayor of Sheffield cuts the ribbon to open the doors. But as a newly self-service operation, Dave must completely transform his approach to keep the tills ringing

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Thomas Plant and David Fletcher are at Norwich Cathedral to select items to take to auction, including a Masonic watch and a sought after commemorative mug by Eric Ravilious. Plus, presenter Paul Martin visits the former home of Robert Walpole Britain's first prime minister

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Edith Bowman, Fern Brady, Will Kirk and Martin Lewis keep their eyes on the prize ahead of Friday's final, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey in the East Yorkshire resort of Hornsea, famous for its distinctive pottery. In Hull, he discovers how one of Hull FC's star players made history as Britain's first black rugby captain. From Hull, Michael hitches a ride on a fine-looking barge heading to Goole on a network of canals. At Spurn Point, Michael hears how along this coast an ingenious 19th-century RNLI invention saved many lives

programme.title: Cricket: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Ireland. Action from day one of the one-off Test from Lord's, as England started their build-up towards The Ashes. The two sides have faced each other once before in this format back in 2019, when England won by 143 runs, as they bowled Ireland out for just 38 in their second innings

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: The nests are proving as exciting as ever and Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan indulge viewers with the highlights ahead of the weekend. Iolo Williams sets sail into Poole Harbour - keen to see a white-tailed eagle or an osprey during the programme. And Gillian Burke travels further north within Snowdonia's National Park to meet a pine marten soon to be released into the wild

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: Part two of two. Charting the start of the historic wave of 2022 strikes, which saw more days lost to strike action since the Thatcher era. Mick Lynch and the RMT are at the forefront of the movement alongside nurses withdrawing their labour for the first time in the union's 106-year history

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Alan arrives at a small village primary school in rural Wales, and throwing himself into his new job, he still finds himself overshadowed by his much-loved predecessor, Mr King. Starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: West Midlands Police work to identify who is responsible for a major fire that has burned a factory in Birmingham to the ground. Fire investigator Luke Beckett is deployed to open the case before vital evidence is destroyed by the blaze, but after searching the wreckage, the cause is still a mystery. With no natural sources of ignition, Luke concludes the fire was started deliberately and, in a stroke of luck, the factory's CCTV room is left intact after the fire

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: Rosamund Kissi-Debrah shares the story of her daughter's death from pollution and surgeon Dr Greg Williams gives tips on choosing the right place to get a hair transplant and avoiding the dodgy practitioners who offer cheap surgery and leave patients with botched jobs and scarred scalps. Plus, the story of former surgeon Ian Paterson who was convicted of 17 counts of wounding with intent and sentenced to 20 years in prison

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: Documentary about the wave of industrial action that engulfed the UK at the end of 2022, with access to union leaders including Mick Lynch of the RMT and Pat Cullen from the Royal College of Nursing. The opening edition charts the start of the strikes, with Lynch and the National Union of Rail, Maritime and Transport Workers at the forefront of the movement, with nurses withdrawing their labour for the first time in the Royal College of Nursing.union's 106-year history

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: A look at the cameras fitted with artificial intelligence software that are being used to detect when a driver is using their mobile phone. Plus, the police teams with night-vision kits who are taking on criminals who prey on isolated rural communities

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores north-east Wales, beginning his journey on a moor near Llangollen to see hen harriers, one of the UK's most threatened birds of prey. He also visits a nature reserve on a bog, discovers the wildlife that has colonised Marford Quarry, and ends his journey on the Dee Estuary, where he sees thousands of wading birds near Point of Ayr

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the last leg of his railway journey around the north-west coast of England, visiting the childhood home of William Wordsworth in Cockermouth, Cumbria, and ending in Maryport, where the Solway Firth marks the border between England and Scotland

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Riya and Nanda have a sad and unloved garden in Groby, Leicestershire, with an outdated pink and yellow 'Battenburg' patio, a tumble down shed and a huge gravel slope. This really is a plot that needs to be rescued, especially as Riya is soon to be married and they are hoping to host some of the celebrations in the garden. Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam offer expert advice, which involves picking up on the reds and golds of Riya's wedding colours in the planting

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: DIY legend Tommy Walsh, expert cleaner Maxine Dwyer and carpenter Asher Edwards head to north London to help grandmother Maura make over her messy lounge. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they build a birdwatching area for her grandchildren, fix the unsafe stairs and give the living room a new identity by creating a multi-purpose family space

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost visits a walled garden in Somerset to meet volunteers who are gardening alongside those who need help to transform their lives. At Longmeadow, Monty Don creates two different planting schemes for pots for shady spaces, transplants grasses in the jewel garden and plants out his favourite varieties of tomatoes. And Rachel de Thame revels in the seasonal displays of Azaleas in Shropshire

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: The chef heads to his home county of Yorkshire, where he studies the landscape from above and investigates the unique environmental factors that have contributed to the creation of West Yorkshire's Rhubarb Triangle. He also examines why the region's wild heather honey is so distinctive, and prepares blow-torched mackerel served with rhubarb chutney and a honey and meringue roulade

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: James Martin makes an 'nduja sausage and sheep's cheese pizza, Steve Brown learns about a UK crop of camomile and Frances Tophill visits a woman in Somerset who grows an impressive range of Thai vegetables. Presented by Gethin Jones

programme.title: What Britain Buys and Sells in a Day
programme.desc: The team looks at the automotive trade, with Ed Balls at the Port of Southampton to see how cars are driven off and on vast vessels at speed and witnessing the exhaustive checks that BMW cars must go through before they reach their owners Cherry Healey visits a Toyota factory in Derbyshire to see how workers turn millions of imported parts a day into new cars, while Ade Adepitan travels to the Tesla Gigafactory in Nevada to see how their batteries are made and what the future holds for British car manufacturing

programme.title: Back in Time for...
programme.desc: The Arden family experience corner shop life in the 1980s and 1990s, when stores changed from primary shopping destinations to a place for last minute impulse buys and were forced to make the maximum use of their floor space to stock thousands of products. The programme examines the impact of new legislation allowing supermarkets to open on Sundays, previously the only advantage small businesses had over them. ABC's Martin Fry visits the shop and reveals how the band used to use empty industrial units as cheap rehearsal space, and there is a look at the rise of the gaming industry and a revival of a famous 1980s marketing stunt

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Highlights of the best finds by experts Anita Manning, Mark Stacey and others during the programme's travels around the country. Items featured include a set of Beatles autographs and a collection of Matchbox toys. Plus, presenter Paul Martin visits the birthplace of novelist and playwright DH Lawrence

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Edith Bowman, Fern Brady, Will Kirk and Martin Lewis take part in the final challenges before the winner is announced by Richard Osman

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo has reached Lincolnshire, where his coastal railway journey from Middlesbrough ends. In Grimsby Town, he investigates a new stage in the town's history - as a maintenance base for some of the largest wind farms in the world. In neighbouring Cleethorpes, Michael rides on the Cleethorpes Coast Light Railway, pulled by a miniature steam locomotive. Later, Michael makes for a curious and wild stretch of coastline at Humberston

programme.title: Cricket: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Ireland. Action from day two of the four-day one-off Test from Lord's. The hosts are using this contest as a warm-up for The Ashes, and will be looking to find their best form ahead of the five-Test series against Australia

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don creates colourful planting schemes with trailing plants, and Toby Buckland revels in the displays of roses at Mount Ephraim Gardens in Kent. We pay a return visit to The Linn Botanic Gardens in Argyll and Bute, where owner, Matthew Young, gets some sage advice about the precious and rare trees in his collection

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: A look at three unique houses in the North East of England that together tell a story of wealth, industry and art in Northumbria. One of the properties is Cragside, an awe-inspiring Victorian mansion, perched in woodland on the edge of a Northumberland moor. It's the Victorian era's ultimate trophy home, built by one of its wealthiest industrialists - William Armstrong

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob and Paul travel to the Crogen Estate in north Wales to fish the River Dee for grayling, a fish that has so far eluded Paul on their extensive travels. They fish hard on a secluded private estate, with Bob displaying some very balletic moves in the river while Paul tries hard to concentrate on landing the prized fish. While Paul continues to fish, Bob decides to set up a bijou coffee shop to refresh his friend

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: Documentary about the wave of industrial action that engulfed the UK at the end of 2022, with access to union leaders including Mick Lynch of the RMT and Pat Cullen from the Royal College of Nursing

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Stories of the Troubles from people on all sides of the conflict, beginning by looking at how the situation in Northern Ireland in the late-1960s deteriorated from a time of relative peace. As the civil rights movement gained pace, demanding equal rights for Catholics, the Provisional IRA came to the fore, causing the British Army to be deployed. With the situation compounded by tactical mistakes, soldiers quickly found themselves caught up in violent clashes - leading to 13 unarmed Catholics being shot dead by British paratroopers in Derry on what becomes known as Bloody Sunday

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: When an armed gang of jewellery thieves robs £300,000 worth of gold from a Birmingham jewellery store, police need to use forensic evidence to track down the gold. West Midland Police's Force Priorities Unit, a specialist team tasked with completing the most high risk jobs and manhunts, swarm the local area to find witnesses and CCTV that could give them a lead

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc: Polar adventurer Paul Rose heads for the North Pennines in the latest stage of his journey. He goes white-water rafting down the River Tees - and takes in one of Britain's best views at High Cup Nick. He also hears about a weather phenomenon unique to the Pennine Way and spends a night at a remote mountain refuge close to the highest point of the route

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc: Exploring the wildlife and culture of the Southeast Asian nation. The first episode examines the south of the country, a popular tourist destination for Westerners, and examines the role of spirituality in daily life. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the largest known cosmic structures, including, a vast cloud of solar plasma which surrounds and protects the solar system, the black hole at the centre of the Milky Way, which emits the lowest note ever heard in the cosmos, and the giant arc, a collection of galaxies which spans more than three per cent of the observable universe

programme.title: The Long Roads
programme.desc: An elderly Scottish woman learns she is dying of cancer, so she and her cantankerous old husband set off to visit their children - now geographically and socially miles apart - and inform them of the news. One-off drama by John McGrath, and starring Edith MacArthur and Robert Urquhart. Originally broadcast in 1993

programme.title: Tails You Win: The Science of Chance
programme.desc: Professor David Spiegelhalter tries to get to grips with chance and how it works. He tackles such questions as whether people are wise to take an umbrella when they go out, to ways of maximising the chances of living to 100, as he tries to establish if luck and fate are embedded in the fabric of the universe. Along the way, he discovers hidden patterns and shapes in a book written exclusively with numbers and explains why going sky-diving only marginally increases his risk of dying sooner rather than later

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc: Polar adventurer Paul Rose heads for the North Pennines in the latest stage of his journey. He goes white-water rafting down the River Tees - and takes in one of Britain's best views at High Cup Nick. He also hears about a weather phenomenon unique to the Pennine Way and spends a night at a remote mountain refuge close to the highest point of the route

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc: Exploring the wildlife and culture of the Southeast Asian nation. The first episode examines the south of the country, a popular tourist destination for Westerners, and examines the role of spirituality in daily life. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the largest known cosmic structures, including, a vast cloud of solar plasma which surrounds and protects the solar system, the black hole at the centre of the Milky Way, which emits the lowest note ever heard in the cosmos, and the giant arc, a collection of galaxies which spans more than three per cent of the observable universe

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc: Polar adventurer Paul Rose explores rural Northumberland as he embarks on the last stage of his journey along the Pennine Way. He makes a remarkable discovery at the Roman archaeological dig at Vindolanda, finds out what lies beyond the red flags while on exercise with the Grenadier Guards and discovers how night-time walkers can have an almost magical experience in an area acclaimed for the quality of its dark skies

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred explores the work of the builders responsible for the waterways of Britain. Visiting the Leeds-Liverpool and Bridgewater canals, he explores their industrial history and demonstrates how early pioneers dug the canals and made them watertight, creating some of Britain's finest engineering

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga explores the house's history from the 1880s to the First World War, a period that saw the property sliding down the social scale and turning from a family home to a multiple occupancy. He discovers how a resident responded to the death of his baby daughter by opening a milk bar for the temperance movement, only to get into legal trouble for watering down his product. David also discovers the story behind a mysterious occupant who lived in the house under a pseudonym and learns how the battle of Passchendaele changed the residents' lives forever

programme.title: Casablanca (1942)
programme.desc: The American expat owner of a Moroccan nightclub is reunited with his old flame during the Second World War. Now married to a Czech freedom fighter, she needs his help to get them safely out of the country before they are captured by the Nazis - but the former lovers also have to wrestle the temptation to rekindle their simmering romance. Drama, with Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Claude Rains and Paul Henreid

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Director Stig Bjorkman's film profiles Oscar-winning Swedish actress Ingrid Bergman, who became one of the most celebrated stars of American and world cinema. With contributions from her daughters Isabella Rossellini and Pia Lindstrom, with Alicia Vikander reading from the Hollywood icon's letters and diaries

programme.title: Expedition Volcano
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team takes a helicopter to the crater of an active volcano in the Democratic Republic of Congo that has rarely been studied. The mountain is surrounded by forests, which provide cover for armed militant groups, and the scientists will only have a few short hours to gather information. They then move on to the surrounding area, a dangerous landscape marked by craters from past eruptions

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Cage fighting pro Stevie 'Braveheart' Ray is just one fight away from becoming Scotland's first world champion. This documentary captures the all-or-nothing tale of the lead-up to a major prize fight - and the aftermath - as told through the eyes of his wife Natalie, a 30-year-old mother of four. The PFL world championship is staged in Madison Square Gardens, New York, and the top prize is a million dollars. However, MMA can be dangerous, with fighters having only a pair of 4oz gloves for protection. Both physical pain and mental health are factors to be considered

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty hosts as comedian Hugh Dennis and Conservative peer Ruth Davidson join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of the news

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Gang member Tevin grows suspicious of Dom and Kay after following them to Hackney police station. Posing as volunteer visitors, the undercover duo set about investigating Riverford Residential Home, suspecting it could be a front for the Brightmarsh Gang. Dom makes an unlikely elderly ally and Kay's commitment to community service finally pays dividends. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie are joined by star guests including First Dates' real-life Cupid Fred Sirieix and fiancée Fruitcake to poke fun at life. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Rookie Nurses
programme.desc: Wales' youngest nurses continue to deal with all kinds of medical challenges thrown their way. In Carmarthen, there's no easing in for very newly qualified Caitlin who has to learn fast in her first week in A&E. Across the ward, her friend and colleague 22-year-old Mikey battles to keep a patient with severe hypothermia alive. On the Stroke Unit in Aberystwyth, a visit from Nelly the pet therapy dog lifts not just the patients' spirits, but the nurses too, while nurse Gina helps keeps moral high on the ward with her funny banter

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Michelle Visage and Henning Wehn join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Eastern Promises (2007)
programme.desc: A midwife trying to locate the remaining family of a baby, whose unidentified teenage mother died in childbirth, unwittingly stumbles into a violent underworld of corruption and people-trafficking among London's Russian immigrant population. David Cronenberg's gangster thriller, starring Naomi Watts, Viggo Mortensen and Vincent Cassel

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: There's a chill in the air as the dinner party drama continues and an explosive argument leaves everyone in shock, but the love game gets back on track when Dannii introduces two new boys, just in time for the Kiss Off

programme.title: Fraud Squad

programme.desc: Kirsten Campbell introduces coverage of questions to First Minister Humza Yousaf in the Scottish Parliament

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Bear is determined to fix things with Claudia, while Zara gets an unexpected message and Al decides to cheer Emma up with a deliciously brilliant plan. When Scarlett is accused of theft, she starts to suspect that a fake carer is taking advantage of her elderly VPAS patients and enlists Suni's help to uncover the truth. With Kim Hartman (Helga in 'Allo, 'Allo)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers is at Wallyford recycling centre on Scotland's east coast hoping to uncover three lucrative items amongst the skip-bound trash. He enlists the help of sign-writer Joel Poole to repurpose some rusty saws, while designer Nicky Cash tries to come up with a creative redesign for an unwanted dressing table and mirror. Meanwhile, JJ sets himself the challenge of transforming a broken-up wooden playhouse

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin help a couple who have £650,000 budget to find a home in Devon, wanting to be close to the coast. Away from the search, he also visits Beer, a picturesque fishing village long associated with smugglers, where he tries not to disturb the residents of the local caves

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Riya and Nanda have a sad and unloved garden in Groby, Leicestershire, with an outdated pink and yellow 'Battenburg' patio, a tumble down shed and a huge gravel slope. This really is a plot that needs to be rescued, especially as Riya is soon to be married and they are hoping to host some of the celebrations in the garden. Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam offer expert advice, which involves picking up on the reds and golds of Riya's wedding colours in the planting

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: DIY legend Tommy Walsh, expert cleaner Maxine Dwyer and carpenter Asher Edwards head to north London to help grandmother Maura make over her messy lounge. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they build a birdwatching area for her grandchildren, fix the unsafe stairs and give the living room a new identity by creating a multi-purpose family space

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Ria Lina joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: Scarlett searches for clarity in light of Andrew's dealings with the police, while Jessie returns to Shieldinch hoping to make amends, but is derailed by a bitter Madonna. Ash gives a dismissive Gillian a lesson in the art of being a DJ

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda is shocked when Elaine's fiancé, George Knight, and his daughters Anna and Gina arrive from Marbella with plans to help run The Vic. Jack and Phil recognise him as a championship boxer and Nish learns very quickly that he is not to be messed with. Bobby is immediately smitten with the Knight girls but things go wrong for them when they try to lift the mood at The Vic

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 19th MasterChef champion

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Leicester to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: King of Thieves (2018)
programme.desc: A thief pulls together a band of misfit criminals to plot the biggest bank heist in British history. The crooks manage to escape with around £200million worth of stolen jewels and money, but when police are called to the scene and the investigation starts, the cracks between the eccentric gang members begin to show, as they row over how to share the goods and become increasingly distrustful of each other. Crime drama based on the Hatton Garden heist, starring Michael Caine, Michael Gambon, Francesca Annis, Jim Broadbent, Ray Winstone and Tom Courtenay

programme.desc: After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 19th MasterChef champion

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers presents a review of the week's political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Leicester to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Brentford defender Ethan Pinnock, Olympic hockey champion Hollie Pearne-Webb, world indoor 60m title-winner Richard Kilty and European gold medal-winning diver Tonia Couch join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Strictly judge Shirley Ballas, Dragon Steven Bartlett, presenter Josie Gibson and comedian Chris McCausland join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Live NBA
programme.desc: Denver Nuggets v Miami Heat (Tip-off 1.30am). Nesta McGregor presents all the action from game one of the NBA Finals, held at Ball Arena. With analysis from Rob Paternostro

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon examine the online reviews that may not be all they appear and offer advice on spotting the real from the fake. Plus, travel expert Simon Calder shares tips, advice and insights

programme.title: Fraud Squad
programme.desc: The conwoman who ripped off multiple public bodies to the tune of £1million. Plus, a supposedly upstanding volunteer suspected of stealing from a pre-school. Presented by Michelle Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow progress on a four-year project to convert a police station in Lancashire, and properties in Nottinghamshire and South Yorkshire are also sold

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the latest contest from Leominster, where he also views the 100-year-old photographs of a local farmer. Guiding the competing teams around an antiques centre in the Herefordshire town are Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Goodfellow turns to Father Brown when he witnesses Mallory frame an innocent man. Mark Williams and John Burton star in the mystery drama, based on the stories by GK Chesterton

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Presenter Jay Blades enlists the help of designer Sarah Peterson to give two side tables a stylish new look, while lighting expert Duncan McKean attempts to give two old record players a radical overhaul. For his own project, Jay attempts to make some money for nothing from two farmhouse stools. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a young couple wanting to swap town life in Halifax, West Yorkshire, for country life in the surroundings of North Yorkshire. Taking a break from the properties, Sonali visits one of the largest farm shops in the UK, where she discovers from its customers and staff just what they think sets it apart from the supermarket chains

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Debra from Wigan, Greater Manchester, wants her new build plot to be transformed into a calming zen garden for relaxation and contemplation. She'd also like it to be low maintenance and maximise the views from the woodland beyond. Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill try to bring her vision to life on a budget of £6,000

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Costume designer Ploy's three-story home is bursting at the seams with designs spilling into every room, preventing her from getting a good night's sleep. ostume designer Ploy's three-story home is bursting at the seams with designs spilling into every room, preventing her from getting a good night's sleep. DIY legend Tommy Walsh, expert cleaner Maxine Dwyer and carpenter Asher Edwards have just 24 hours on a limited budget to organise her space, create a bespoke craft area, and clear the chaos from the conservatory

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Ria Lina joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Feed Yourself Fitter with Stephen Nolan
programme.desc: Stephen meets 50-year-old Caroline from Newry, who has been struggling with weight since she started the menopause and often turns to crisps and snacks to keep her energy levels up. Her recent weight gain is affecting her joints and she's worried that if she doesn't change her ways, she may lose the ability to do this and remain active and sociable. Chef Shauna Froydenlund has so many ideas and tastes for Caroline and Stephen to try. However, when Shauna's dish turns out to be Caroline's food hell, there's the potential for things in the kitchen to go terribly wrong

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Award-winning architect Patrick Bradley meets ordinary people on a mission to restore and transform some of Northern Ireland's historic buildings. Beginning in east Belfast, Patrick meets a couple looking to future proof their lives by downsizing from a large family house to a small 19th-century gate lodge with plans to restore and extend it to create their dream home. While building work is underway, the host explores what life would have been like when the gate lodge was originally built and the house it served, which was once owned by the first Prime Minister of Northern Ireland, James Craig

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Cage fighting pro Stevie 'Braveheart' Ray is just one fight away from becoming Scotland's first world champion. This documentary captures the all-or-nothing tale of the lead-up to a major prize fight - and the aftermath - as told through the eyes of his wife Natalie, a 30-year-old mother of four. The PFL world championship is staged in Madison Square Gardens, New York, and the top prize is a million dollars. However, MMA can be dangerous, with fighters having only a pair of 4oz gloves for protection. Both physical pain and mental health are factors to be considered

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty hosts as comedian Hugh Dennis and Conservative peer Ruth Davidson join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of the news

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Gang member Tevin grows suspicious of Dom and Kay after following them to Hackney police station. Posing as volunteer visitors, the undercover duo set about investigating Riverford Residential Home, suspecting it could be a front for the Brightmarsh Gang. Dom makes an unlikely elderly ally and Kay's commitment to community service finally pays dividends. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie are joined by star guests including First Dates' real-life Cupid Fred Sirieix and fiancée Fruitcake to poke fun at life. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Angie, Vince and Rosa receive unwanted Mother's Day surprises, while Oly and Santi are faced with a reality they aren't ready for. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump

programme.desc: A midwife trying to locate the remaining family of a baby, whose unidentified teenage mother died in childbirth, unwittingly stumbles into a violent underworld of corruption and people-trafficking among London's Russian immigrant population. David Cronenberg's gangster thriller, starring Naomi Watts, Viggo Mortensen and Vincent Cassel

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: From enhancing healthcare to streamlining working lives and even offering companionship, artificial intelligence is pushing the boundaries of what was once thought possible, but the race to harness this technology raises unsettling questions. In this programme, Rachel Younger explores the promise and the perils of artificial intelligence and investigates if humankind can keep up with the machines

programme.title: Ithaka: The Fight to Free Assange
programme.desc: Filmed over two years and across three continents, this documentary tells the story of the campaign by Julian Assange's wife and father to prevent his extradition to America, where he faces a maximum 175-year prison sentence. Weaving historic archive and intimate behind-the-scenes footage, the film tracks their journey as they embark on a worldwide odyssey to rally a global network of supporters for one of the world's most famous prisoners

programme.desc: A skills upgrade increases Chuck's knowledge of kung fu, but his new abilities prove problematic in spy training and create conflict with Sarah

programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, The Only Way Is Essex star, Bobby Norris chooses three women to date based on the menus he most likes the look of, before choosing to see one of them again

Drama based on the book by Ann Cleeves, starring Brenda Blethyn and David Leon

programme.title: Scott & Bailey

programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspicious death in an army barracks, aided by Joe and an enthusiastic member of the military police. Although the demise of commanding officer Dev initially looks like suicide, a case for murder is quickly established and the team's first task is to find a motive. Sensing a connection to Ollie, a soldier killed in Afghanistan, Vera interviews the victim's loyal comrades and Ollie's grieving family, discovering a traumatic event that nobody wants to talk about. programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet comes face to face with the man who left her fighting for life just months earlier - serial killer Geoff Hastings, who has vowed to finally reveal the full extent of his crimes. Rachel and the rest of the team investigate the racially motivated murder of a taxi driver. On the personal front, Andy refuses to take no for an answer, so Janet threatens to report him to the DCI. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones, with an appearance by Kevin Doyle (Downton Abbey's Molesley)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel meets Sean's son, who turns out to be an eight-year-old version of his dad, and the idea of becoming a stepmum puts her further off the idea of marriage than she was before - not that she even agreed in the first place. Andy asks Janet out for a drink, but when she turns him down he accuses her of leading him on. A woman in a sexy cop's uniform turns up dead, and the DCI assumes the killer was her lover - the question is, which one of her many lovers was it? And to add to the mystery, why was her face painted green?

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Strange things are happening at Leopard's Den as Danny prepares to leave for the UK. Frogs have seemingly rained down overnight, the giraffe refuses to budge from the front gate and the cheetah has lost its appetite. Danny jumps at the chance to have one last adventure before his return home - tracking a lioness that attacked a tourist - but it could end in tragedy. Meanwhile, Du Plessis makes an alarming discovery about Ed and Fiona

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur spots a potential darts champion and enters him in a contest, where he duly gets nobbled. Undeterred, the dodgy dealer comes up with the idea of staging his own darts tournament. However, fewer players than expected enter, and Arthur is left scrambling to raise the prize money. Comedy drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: A recently released convict causes chaos when he takes a group of hospital patients hostage. Bodie and Doyle try to get to him before he can start shooting. Drama, starring Martin Shaw, Lewis Collins and Gordon Jackson

programme.title: The Champions
programme.desc: Two members of the team come to blows when Nemesis agents find themselves programmed to kill their own colleagues. Fantasy drama, starring William Gaunt, Alexandra Bastedo and Stuart Damon as crusading heroes with superhuman powers

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A desperate girl contacts Holmes and asks him to clear her boyfriend of killing his father, a farmer found bludgeoned to death beside a lake. Period drama, starring Jeremy Brett , Peter Vaughan and James Purefoy

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: In the heart of Central America lurks a marine creature believed to reach 8ft in length and weigh up to 300lbs. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is taken to breaking point as he re-evaluates everything he knows about fishing in an attempt to catch this monster - which is known to leap into boats and cause fatal injuries

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: On the Canada-US border lies a vast lake that hides a dark history. For Native Americans it's an ancient and sacred site, but recently something has risen up from the depths to attack swimmers, and stories abound of an invasion of primordial bloodsuckers. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade plunges into the heart of a waterfall in the Pacific Northwest on a mission to catch the oldest river monster of his career

programme.title: Magnum, PI

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Doyle is shot by an intruder in his flat, and enters a near coma. Cowley fears a terrorist group - two of whose members were blown up during a recent car chase by CI5 - is responsible. While Doyle experiences surreal dreams involving a ghostly graveyard, Cowley and Bodie attempt to pursue the villain behind the attack. Action drama, with Martin Shaw, Lewis Collins and Gordon Jackson

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur is held by the police after a car he is importing from Europe is impounded by drugs officers, so Terry goes in search of those he suspects are responsible for his boss' predicament - the vehicle's original owners. Light-hearted crime drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Giant Lobster Hunters
programme.desc: Tensions hit boiling point on the William Norling as deckhand Macca makes a monumental blunder that threatens to sink the career of Skipper Danny. Meanwhile, Tasmanian skipper Bryce goes head-to-head with a ferocious storm alone as his deckhand Lachy is sick in bed with a stomach bug

programme.title: BattleBots
programme.desc: Brutus, Warhawk and End Game fight for a guaranteed spot, as the last round of bots put everything on the line to make it into the Sweet 16 round

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. programme.title: Minder

Action drama, with Martin Shaw, Lewis Collins and Gordon Jackson

When she bursts into song in the middle of the night and prevents any sleep, Mo and Sam break down and together invoke the power to control people's voices!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. To please Stella, Mo summons the power to have the 'Gorgeous' filter that Lenny has on his smartphone in real life - this means that he gets wind in his hair, an ultra-bright smile, and a slight yet flattering soft-focus effect applied to him permanently, but when at half-power, Mo ends up with an 'Animal Ears' filter instead! He is in despair, but Sam is delighted - thanks to her squirrel ears, she gains the trust of animals and enjoys magical experiences in the park!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes

He fills the gap in a flash by taking one of his mother's anatomical models to school to pass it off as his own creation. It works, but Selina quickly realises that the foot is missing and warns Mo that he'll be in serious trouble - to make things worse, the model foot is stuffed with Mo's favourite video game, the one that Selina took from him and hid! Mo therefore has to break into Brick's office in order to get it back.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is due to take part in an eloquence contest whose prize was won by her mother and her grandmother when they were young - the pressure is on Sam, and that makes her unbelievably tense. Sam realises that she is lost for words when she feels stressed - to avoid catastrophe, she asks the Sceptre for the power of repartee. The half-power does provide her with snappy answers, but they are extremely caustic, and that's just the start of her problems...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo thinks that he's going to become a star when Mr Brick chooses him to represent the school in his new advertising campaign, but Mo instead finds his face on a huge billboard with a line telling everybody that he is a very poor student. Angry, Mo wants to get rid of such publicity right now, so he summons the power to control advertising, but he realises that he is forced to advertise everything that he touches at half-power and ends up managing to close the school.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. While searching for a game console that Selina has confiscated, Mo finds two tickets for the 'Isaac the Psychic' show, but only one child's ticket! Lenny feels sorry for his buddy, but when he tries to console him, he makes things worse without meaning to. Mo is eaten up with paranoia as he's convinced that Sam has always been their mother's favourite - to make sure that he's the one that Selina takes, Mo invokes the power to be the favourite of whoever he wants...

He meets those running social media accounts with tens of thousands of followers viewing extreme, dangerous and even illegal driving, and heads to car meets across the UK. programme.title: Gender Wars
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on polarising conversations surrounding the meaning of sex and gender, featuring contributions from people at the heart of the dialogue. programme.title: 60 Days on the Estates
programme.desc: With more than one million households on England's social housing waiting list, according to Shelter England's social housing deficit campaign, filmmaker Ed Stafford moves into some of the UK's most troubled housing estates for 60 days and nights, to look beyond the tabloid headlines and experience first-hand the daily hardships that locals face. In this opening episode, Ed is in Northumberland Park, north London, where he meets a mum with three sets of twins under 11 who live in a one-bed council flat which has recurring damp. He also meets a 45-year-old resident who started smoking crack at 17 and now lives alone in a housing association flat

programme.desc: The actor meets Eastender Babs Clark, who was just eight when the Second World War began. programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene
programme.desc: In December 2019, police are called to Brighton seafront after a hit-and-run leaves three young men lying unconscious in the road. The three men are rushed to the hospital as police descend on the city centre and close down the road as a crime scene. CSIs urgently begin to forensically harvest the scene - sampling any blood and recovering any clothing, while drones record the layout and a 3D laser scan is made of the area

programme.title: Police: Suspect No 1
programme.desc: Detectives investigate after a violent attack on a group of friends on a night out leaves one of them critically injured and fighting for his life in hospital. Rob also visits the 'living' museum at Beamish and rides a railway from George Stephenson's day, following an old line into Hartlepool, where a medieval port was turned into a mega-centre of coal, rail and shipping in just one generation
