programme.title: The Cotswolds with Pam Ayres
programme.desc: Pam's journey begins beyond the Cotswolds borders at Highclere Castle, one of Britain's most recognisable stately homes and now better known as Downton Abbey. As well as exploring some rooms that will be familiar to millions of TV viewers, she finds out more about Highclere's fantastic gardens, designed by Capability Brown, and learns about Highclere's involvement in the discovery of Tutankhamun's tomb in Egypt 100 years ago

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Susan Calman's Grand Day Out
programme.desc: The comedian explores the Isle of Man, and discovers an island of beautiful landscapes, friendly people and exciting discoveries. Susan kicks off her latest adventure exploring the historic port of Peel. In this former Viking stronghold, she meets a prolific treasure hunter before joining the crew of a Viking longboat for a trip around the harbour

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: A six-hour journey through Yorkshire to Northumbria and the Borders onboard the Tornado, enjoying some of the best food and luxury service that trains can offer. While in Northumbria there is the chance to discover local traditions such as Craster's famous smokery and kippers, and step back in time to delve into the wonders that lie beneath the sand at Bamburgh

programme.title: Dick Emery: The Naughty Bits & More
programme.desc: Friends and colleagues of funnyman Dick Emery share their stories, screen rare home movies, and reveal the man behind the mask. There's a look at his personal life, including his five marriages, and his love/hate relationship with comedy caricatures such as Mandy, whose 'Ooh, you are awful,' catchphrase was also used as the title for his starring feature in 1972

programme.title: Britain's Favourite 80s Songs
programme.desc: Janice Long recalls the hits of 1982, when ABC, Culture Club, Musical Youth, Tears for Fears, the Stranglers, Kraftwerk, the Jam, Yazoo, and the Goombay Dance Band made their way up the charts. Toyah Willcox, Paul Gambaccini, Cheryl Baker and Clare Grogan add their thoughts on the era

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Peter faces a struggle to save a baby alpaca that was born prematurely during a storm, and Julian performs a delicate eye operation on a labrador preparing for a dog show. A wallaby dies at a local visitor farm, raising concerns that its joey will not survive without its mother's milk and pouch. A newborn lamb suffers a potentially fatal injury, and a rabbit named Boris needs to be castrated if it is to stay in its new home

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow reveals how the Renaissance movement found a new centre in Venice and examines the life and work of Tiziano Vecellio, known to English-speakers as Titian, who pioneered the use of oils with a radical approach to light, colour and brush strokes. His talent was recognised across Europe and he painted portraits of some of the 16th century's most powerful figures, including Pope Paul III and Charles V of Spain

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice visits a house off a busy road in Wandsworth, south London, where she decides the walls need repainting and the floors require sanding

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy sets off on a round-the-world voyage, but when her mast breaks she finds herself stranded at sea. Neptune is put out on the water to rescue her, but Elvis forgets to secure the motor and it drops into the ocean

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: When Merlin the stealth engine comes to Sodor from the mainland for the first time, Percy is determined to see this 'invisible' engine

programme.title: A Lawless Street (1955)
programme.desc: A long-serving marshal, who has done his utmost to the keep peace in the town of Medicine Bend, looks forward to a reconciliation with his estranged wife, a touring musical star. Just as she arrives in town, three notorious criminals show up and start causing trouble - and the lawman has to decide whether to hang up his guns for his wife's sake or do his duty. Western, with Randolph Scott, Angela Lansbury, Jean Parker and Warner Anderson

programme.title: We're No Angels (1955)
programme.desc: Three convicts escape from the penal colony on notorious Devil's Island and seize a French family's shop - only to find themselves helping the storekeeper outwit his scheming relatives. Comedy, starring Humphrey Bogart, Peter Ustinov, Aldo Ray and Basil Rathbone

programme.title: The Rare Breed (1966)
programme.desc: An English widow decides to fulfil her cattle farmer husband's final wish of introducing the Hereford breed to America. She finds a cattleman in Texas willing to help, but first she and her daughter must transport their prize bull across the wilderness, with the aid of a sceptical ranch hand. Romantic comedy Western, starring Maureen O'Hara and James Stewart

programme.title: The Running Man (1963)
programme.desc: A pilot with a chip on his shoulder sets out to take revenge on a money-grubbing insurance company by faking his own death and moving to Spain on the payout. However, just when everything seems to be going swimmingly, an investigator turns up unannounced. Drama, starring Laurence Harvey, Lee Remick and Alan Bates

programme.title: Men in Black 3 (2012)
programme.desc: An alien criminal escapes from a prison on the moon and goes back in time on a mission of revenge, changing the course of history. Agent J of the top-secret Earth defence organisation follows him back to 1969, and joins forces with a younger version of his mentor Agent K to set things right. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Will Smith, Josh Brolin and Tommy Lee Jones

programme.title: Bloodshot (2020)
programme.desc: Marine Ray Garrison is shot dead during a mission but regains consciousness in Kuala Lumpur in the care of Dr Emil Harting. The medic brought Ray back to life using nanotechnology, augmenting the Marine's strength, agility, speed and healing capabilities on the battlefield. Rechristened Bloodshot, Garrison wages top-secret war alongside other enhanced killing machines, while piecing together a conspiracy that robbed him of the woman he loved. Sci-fi thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Eiza Gonzalez and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Daredevil (2003)
programme.desc: A blind lawyer with radar-like sensory perception takes to the streets to battle the evil he cannot fight in the courts. But during his quest to bring down the elusive Kingpin, who controls the New York underworld, he is hunted by a crazed hitman and falls into a dangerous romance with a mysterious heiress. Comic-book adventure, with Ben Affleck, Michael Clarke Duncan, Jennifer Garner and Colin Farrell

programme.title: Blade of the Immortal (2017)
programme.desc: An immortal warrior is hired by a young woman to avenge the murder of her father. Director Takashi Miike's fantasy drama, starring Takuya Kimura, Hana Sugisaki and Sota Fukushi. In Japanese with English subtitles

programme.title: The Red Pony (1949)
programme.desc: A boy seeks solace from his feuding family through his friendships with his beloved pony and a ranch hand, whom he idolises. When the animal dies his relationship with his father seems to be damaged irreparably. Drama based on a short story by John Steinbeck, starring Robert Mitchum, Myrna Loy and Peter Miles

programme.title: Shenandoah (1965)
programme.desc: A Virginian farmer is left to raise seven children after his wife dies. He tries to keep his family out of the American Civil War, but when Union troops abduct his son, and his son-in-law enlists with the Confederates, he is unable to maintain his neutral stance and is dragged into the conflict. Western, starring James Stewart, Doug McClure, Rosemary Forsyth, Katharine Ross and Patrick Wayne

programme.title: Captain Scarlett (1953)
programme.desc: A brave nobleman forms a band of outlaws to free 19th-century French villagers from the tyranny of an evil duke, reclaim his birthright and save a lovely princess from a fate worse than death at the hands of a lecherous count. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Richard Greene, Leonora Amar, Nedrick Young and Manolo Fabregas

programme.title: An Affair to Remember (1957)
programme.desc: Love blossoms on the high seas for a playboy bachelor and a former nightclub singer during a transatlantic cruise. When the liner comes into dock at New York, they agree to wait for six months and then meet again at the Empire State Building, hoping to prove to each other their relationship is more than a shipboard affair. Romantic drama, with Cary Grant, Deborah Kerr, Cathleen Nesbitt, Richard Denning and Neva Patterson

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit (1993)
programme.desc: A cabaret singer who once hid out in a convent is reunited with the nuns she befriended, who now need her help. She poses as a member of the order once more and joins the staff of a Catholic school threatened with closure, where she aims to make a success of the resident choir. Comedy sequel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Najimy, Lauryn Hill, Maggie Smith and James Coburn

programme.title: Commando (1985)
programme.desc: The daughter of retired special forces officer John Matrix is kidnapped by an old comrade-in-arms, now in league with a deposed former dictator. The tyrant plans to use the girl to force Matrix into assassinating the head of the country he once ruled, but is unprepared for the lengths to which the veteran soldier will go to rescue his child. Action adventure, with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Rae Dawn Chong

programme.title: The Worst Person in the World (2021)
programme.desc: The chronicles of four years in the life of Julie, a young woman who navigates the troubled waters of her love life and struggles to find her career path, leading her to take a realistic look at who she really is. Comedy romance, starring Renate Reinsve. In Norwegian with English subtitles

programme.title: Thelma (2017)
programme.desc: A student starts to experience extreme seizures while studying at university in Oslo and soon learns that the violent episodes are a symptom of inexplicable - and often dangerous - supernatural abilities. Thriller, starring Eili Harboe and Kaya Wilkins. In Norwegian

programme.title: Gunfight at the OK Corral (1957)
programme.desc: US Marshal Wyatt Earp lays down his badge to live a peaceful life with his brothers in the town of Tombstone. As a feud erupts with the ruthless Clanton gang, he forms an unlikely alliance with hard-drinking gambler Doc Holliday to face them in a historic showdown. Western, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas, Dennis Hopper, Lee Van Cleef and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: The Tin Star (1957)
programme.desc: A world-weary bounty hunter, formerly a sheriff, arrives in a small town where a newly-appointed lawman is struggling to keep the peace. When he learns of the mercenary's past, the inexperienced lawman seeks his help in learning the tricks of the trade so he can bring an outlaw gang to justice. Anthony Mann's Western, starring Henry Fonda, Anthony Perkins, Lee Van Cleef, Betsy Palmer and Michel Ray

programme.title: Oliver! (1968)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical version of the stage play based on Charles Dickens' classic tale about a lonely workhouse orphan who ends up on the cold streets of London, where he falls under the wing of petty crook Fagin and his gang of young backstreet thieves. Featuring the iconic songs Food, Glorious Food, Consider Yourself, As Long as He Needs Me and You've Got to Pick a Pocket or Two. Starring Ron Moody, Mark Lester, Oliver Reed, Jack Wild, Harry Secombe, Shani Wallis and Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: Transformers (2007)
programme.desc: Teenager Sam Witwicky is treated to his first car by his dad, but it turns out to be an alien scout with a life of its own. Before long, the vehicle embroils Sam in a long-running intergalactic war between two factions of giant shape-changing robots, which have come to Earth to find a mystical cube that grants infinite power to its possessor. Michael Bay's sci-fi action adventure, inspired by the toy franchise, with Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Josh Duhamel, Jon Voight and John Turturro

programme.title: Ronin (1998)
programme.desc: A freelance former US intelligence agent is recruited alongside a team of fellow mercenaries to take part in an international plot to capture a briefcase from a gang of criminals. However, after the mission is completed, one member of the crew decides to betray his equally ruthless comrades-in-arms - with inevitably explosive results. John Frankenheimer's action thriller, starring Robert De Niro, Jean Reno, Natascha McElhone, Sean Bean, Stellan Skarsgard and Jonathan Pryce

programme.title: Snatch (2000)
programme.desc: An unlicensed boxing promoter and his dim-witted sidekick convince an Irish gypsy to step in for their injured fighter, but find themselves drawn into a match-fixing racket. Meanwhile, the loot from a diamond heist goes missing, leading to a bloody conflict between Russian gangsters and a Jewish mob. Guy Ritchie's comedy drama, with Jason Statham, Brad Pitt, Benicio Del Toro and Stephen Graham

programme.title: Blindspotting (2018)
programme.desc: A man struggles to finish the last days of his probation, haunted by an incident in which he witnessed a white police officer shoot down a fleeing black man in the back. He then begins to re-evaluate his relationship with his volatile best friend. Crime drama with a light-hearted edge, starring Daveed Diggs and Rafael Casal

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Ethan may have found a way to make all of Sienna's dreams come true. Felix and Warren cannot see eye to eye, and Imran puts his best friend first

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Scott is exhausted and unable to sleep, so Jack offers him some parenting advice. Elsewhere, Juliet makes Juliet a promise, and Ethan is in Sienna's bad books

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the conclusion of Gordon Ramsay's visit to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, he confronts sisters Rita and Lisa with an ultimatum, and finds himself stuck in a war between the waiters, chefs and owners over who is to blame for the Italian restaurant's failings

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave tries to help Calvin find out why his employees are quitting. Starring Cedric the Entertainer and Max Greenfield

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Tina enjoys the perks that come with her 'stardom' when she is mistaken for an A-list celebrity. Starring Cedric the Entertainer and Max Greenfield

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard turns to Penny for advice when his relationship with Stephanie takes off faster than he would have liked, and he realises he is the last person to notice that she has moved in with him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's obsession with gift-giving etiquette annoys his friends as Christmas approaches. Meanwhile, Leonard is thrilled to meet an award-winning scientist, only to be filled with jealousy when his new colleague takes an interest in Penny. With guest star Michael Trucco (Battlestar Galactica, One Tree Hill)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam is determined to lead the Dolphins to victory in a big football game, showing no mercy to the opposition despite the fact they are playing with an unexpected disadvantage. Off the field, Phil tries to teach his kids about optimism, but nothing seems to be going his way. Meanwhile, at Pritchett Closets & Blinds, Claire is desperate to prove to her colleagues that she is more than just the boss's daughter. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Christmas has arrived, providing a typically chaotic time for the Pritchett-Dunphys, as Jay takes Manny to chop down a tree, Mitchell rushes to finish his shopping and Cam and Lily get into the holiday spirit at a charity event. Meanwhile, Gloria has a visit from her mum. Directed by Breaking Bad star Bryan Cranston

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

An uncle's part in the defeat of Nazi Germany in the Second World War is also highlighted. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be traced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Bell House Hotel in Wiltshire, where business partners Chris Williams and Jacqui Hogg hope guests will appreciate their attempts to bring London chic to the shires. Susan and David Speak are frustrated by the low shower pressure, while Jade Hendon butts heads with Matthew over healthy eating at dinner and the hosts' absence at breakfast the next morning gets the criticism flowing

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Partridge in Oxfordshire, where young couple Matthew Cockman and Paula Szkwarkowska hope guests will get on board with their passion for local organic food. A communal bathroom has the guests lost for words, and the lack of a hot breakfast included in the price leaves a bad taste in everyone's mouths

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Strawberry Gardens B&B in Heysham for the third day of the contest, where husband and wife team Susan and David Speak offer home-from-home accommodation and an abundance of northern hospitality. Sports enthusiast David treats his guests to a traditional darts competition, adjudicated by former world champion Alan Warriner-Little, but he is unimpressed when Paula sends back her evening meal. However, it is Chris and Jacqui's feedback that disappoints the hosts the most

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Bateman's Mill near Chesterfield, where manager Jade Hendon has high hopes of being the best. But she faces an uphill battle when David and Susan go out of their way to find hairs in the bathroom - and to make mattters worse, her Derbyshire breakfast is not a hit with Chris and Jacqui

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores, starting with Chris and Jacqui, owners of the Bell House, who want to find out why Matthew marked them down for being 'too tall' for his bed. The group members proceed to thrash out their differences before the week's winners are revealed

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Documentary following Dick Strawbridge and Angel Adoree through the process of buying and restoring a French chateau that has been empty for the past four decades. Their new home has 12 acres of land, nine outbuildings, a walled garden and a moat - but it also has no electricity, heating or water, and proves to be a far more complicated DIY project than expected

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Excitable French bulldog Buddy arrives at the centre. His owners have tried selling him seven times but every time he has been rejected. Can the staff finally find him a forever home? An eight-year-old girl who always wanted a small dog has her mind changed when she sees stray labrador Leah, and nervous collie Kimmie needs another dog to keep her company

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Boat enthusiast James Strangeways invites Kevin McCloud to survey progress on the construction of his new home, which his architect nephew Ben Hebblethwaite has designed to be as 'un-houselike' as possible. James has spent the past 35 years travelling the canals and waterways of Britain, and despite never liking houses, has decided now is the time to put down roots on dry land. Ben hoped a home standing on stilts above a marsh in East Sussex, and incorporating ship-like qualities such as a keel-shaped roof, will be enough to satisfy his boat-mad uncle. However, Ben's contractor goes into liquidation a few months into the project, taking £87,000 of the £300,000 budget, and when James decides to make a few tweaks to the design, alarm-bells begin to ring for the young architect

programme.title: Tutankhamun: Secrets of the Tomb
programme.desc: Part one of two. On 26th November 1922, Howard Carter made the greatest archaeological find of all time - the treasure-filled tomb of Egyptian boy king Tutankhamun. An unrivalled discovery made possible by Carter's extraordinary tenacity and the dedicated financier by his side, Lord Carnarvon. But when people who entered the tomb began dying, tales spread of a Pharaoh's Curse. In this first episode, paleo-anthropologist Ella Al-Shamahi begins to unravel the extraordinary scientific truth behind the legend and the press sensation that surrounded it for decades. As she travels from Tut's tomb in Egypt's Valley of the Kings, to a shrine in Wawel cathedral in Krakow, Poland, the investigation links a series of mysterious deaths in both locations, each attributed to a 'curse'. Ella unearths the truly deadly secret lurking in these tombs

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Cameras reveal what can go wrong when a dream holiday turns into a nightmare. Footage includes sunbed dashes, ski crashes, Brits behaving badly and locals behaving madly, all told by the people who were there. Psychologists and industry experts also reflect on the anxieties and situations that many can experience during a break

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Mark, a 35-year-old long-term resident at a neurological hospital, is rushed to St George's struggling to breathe, and his devoted parents are with him as doctors attempt to get to the bottom of his symptoms. Three-year-old Thomas is brought in with a high temperature by his parents, who are concerned as he was born with an extremely rare blood condition that meant he needed a full blood exchange when he was less than 24 hours old

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Catriona is worried that a man might lose his sight after an awful workplace accident. Dr George and Dr Rosie need to electrocute the heart of a father of two, and a racetrack worker needs all of Dr Michelle's skills after a freak quad-bike accident.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton visits the world's largest jelly bean producers to discover what they are made of instead of gelatine, and Matt Tebbutt finds out why maple syrup is so expensive

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Chris and Allan have been together for 10 years and with three grown up children between them, are hoping to buy their first home together - somewhere they can go to relax and unwind in Manilva, Spain. programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A drive for new custom pays off for a microbrewery in Spain, a weaving business launches in Portugal and a couple in Andalucia aim to make money from their love of crafting

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit two sisters at their south Wales workshop, where their restorations and upcycles include a Gothic-style organ and a half-size snooker table

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole comes across a tractor and Simon O'Brien finds a small-wheeled design classic as the pair search for money-making items in Norfolk

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Research into two family trees uncovers how Britain's post-war building boom boosted Irish immigration, and how the British infantry fought their way across the border into Nazi Germany. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs are still being sought

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Research into family trees uncovers the history of domestic service in one of the world's most prestigious universities and how luxury transatlantic steamliners helped change the course of history. Plus, details of unclaimed estates with heirs still needing to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at David and Ewa Woodward's Keats Cottage in Shanklin on the Isle of Wight. In the rooms, Donna Taylor from Jasmine House in Leicestershire makes a hair-raising discovery, while mother-and-daughter team Lesley and Chloe Priestly take a dislike to one of their competitors at dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Jasmine House in Lutterworth, Leicestershire managed by Donna Taylor who believes in a no frills approach. But it doesn't take long for Martin and Sara to realise all the added extras in the room don't add up. During the afternoon Leslie and Chloe show their fighting spirit during a kickboxing lesson and all the B&Bers square up to their host

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the luxury Halliwell House in Cheshire for the third day of the contest, where owners Martin Hulme and Sara Williams charge nearly £500 per night. Donna is astonished at the room rates, while David and Ewa are expecting nothing but perfection, but the self-service approach at breakfast confuses the guests, leaving Martin and Sara defiant in the face of their feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final two days see the contestants staying the night at Soar Chapel Guest House in Ebbw Vale, the family home of mum and daughter Lesley and Chloe Priestly. Expectations are high for this duo and one guest in particular is not disappointed. Things get going in the afternoon during a beatboxing contest, although old tensions resurface at dinner and the hosts are left to calm things down. A massive spread is laid on at breakfast, but when one guest takes issue with the cooked items, Lesley and Chloe worry what impact it will have come payment day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. David and Ewa Woodward want to challenge Martin's criticism over the way they run their business. Next, Donna Taylor wants to find out more about the issue that caused Martin and Sara to lose sleep. programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge and Angel Adoree only have a few weeks to prepare for their wedding, but the chateau is nowhere near ready to receive the 200 guests they have invited and finding reliable, affordable workers is proving difficult. Dick oversees the damming of the moat and the installation of a new, eco-friendly sewage system, while Angel turns her attention to giving the rooms a distinctive decor

programme.title: The Dog House

programme.title: Grand Designs

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations

programme.desc: Exploring the hopes and expectations of three different men and how they respond to changes that are beyond their control. They include Stanlie, 24, who is airlifted to St George's by helicopter paramedics after being impaled on a metal rod at a construction site

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. The boys head to Suffolk to meet Margaret, an avid collector who is also a former mayor, so they need to be on their best behaviour

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives try to find the relatives of a south London woman, but they are misled by a trail of dubious clues and are left questioning their knowledge. Meanwhile, research into family trees reveals the lives of British soldiers in 19th-century India

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Product designer Rebecca Sturrock has returned to her family home in Cornwall with her partner Gregory Kewish and a highly ambitious plan. The design is radical - to reinforce the walls of the old property and add a new living space on top to take advantage of the views. This extra floor will be made entirely of thick wooden panels engineered in Germany and normally assembled by a crew of specialist installers. However, budget constraints mean the couple are determined to do it all themselves

programme.title: Rick Stein's Secret France
programme.desc: Rick's tour brings him to Perigord, which is famous for its black truffles and walnuts, as well as duck dishes. He pays a visit to his favourite market in the city of Perigueux, and traces the historic connections between England and the city, which was once known as the Kingdom of Aquitaine. Inspired by his visit, he returns to the kitchen to prepare Enchaud, a traditional pot roast pork from the region, before heading towards the shores of the Mediterranean and the Cote Catalan near the Spanish border

programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police search a flat selling narcotics, pull a speeding learner driver over, and respond to a yacht in distress in Sydney Harbour.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: People forced out of their homes in Honduras by the notorious MS-13 gang plead their case for asylum in America. Officers discover 3,000lb of marijuana hidden in a cargo truck

programme.title: Top Gear

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness confront the male mid-life crisis by buying the perfect sports cars for a middle-aged gentleman. Back at the track, Chris tests out the raucous new Toyota GR Yaris hot hatch

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor ends his journey by learning to drive a stunt car, sampling Hollywood luxury in an executive jet, cruising in a 1950s hot rod and taking an aerial tour

programme.title: Rick Stein's Secret France
programme.desc: Rick's journey takes him to the Spanish border and the Mediterranean coast. He discovers how Catalan and French influences have shaped the culinary legacy of Roussillon in the foothills of the Pyrenees, and samples some of the area's famous mountain cuisine, including grilled sausages, snails and fresh fish caught in a self-contained seawater lake - all with generous servings of the region's famous garlic mayonnaise. Back in his country kitchen, Rick prepares pork and beef meatballs in a tomato and piment sauce

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: David Baddiel, Ed Gamble, Jo Brand, Katy Wix and Rose Matafeo are now waist-deep in the Taskmaster swamp. This time, David goes topless and Katy robs a piggy bank (of its undercarriage). Meanwhile, Greg Davies' assistant Alex Horne is powerless in the face of Ed's creative vision

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton return for the domestic comedy, which sees the couple continuing to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In the first episode, Geoffrey reluctantly allows Lee to help Lucy clear up the builder's mess in their new kitchen extension. With Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy arranges a special surprise for Lee's birthday, which sees their family and friends joining them in a Crystal Maze-style physical adventure game where the objective is to escape from a series of rooms. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: David Mitchell, Noel Fielding and Holly Walsh join Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme of 'night' in an extended edition of the panel show. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Comedy actors Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer travel to the picturesque River Usk in south Wales, where Paul's father first taught him to fish as a young child. The duo discuss their respective childhoods and reflect on their own family lives and values. In their cosy cottage accommodation in the heart of the countryside they compare school photographs and Paul serenades Bob with his guitar. Once outside in the picturesque environment, their quarry is the wild brown trout

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer brave the wild lakes of Essex in search of the mighty carp. They have the latest high-tech equipment to catch the biggest fish they can - and are fully prepared to stay all night if they have to. The pair discuss the true meaning of a mid-life crisis and decide to visit a beauty clinic to see whether there are any suitable treatments available to re-capture their youth. Bob reveals his secret recipe to make the perfect scrambled eggs - but it's not the only thing that shocks Paul

programme.desc: Fred navigates Snowdonia and the Llanberis Pass, before starting his journey from Bolton to Buckingham Palace to collect his MBE

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: The history of the steeplejack's favourite sites, beginning with his home town of Bolton, which was a hive of busy factories during the 1940s and 1950s when Britain led the industrialised world

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Steered by his 1913 Bradshaw railway guide, Michael Portillo takes the train down the spine of Italy as he travels from Rome to Sicily. He begins by weaving among the capital city's landmarks on the back of a 1950s Vespa, before boarding the train south to Naples, where he finds out about the first railway to be built in the country, and ventures into the crater of Mount Vesuvius. He takes a detour to the island of Capri, before finishing his journey in the ancient hilltop town of Taormina

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Referring to his trusty Bradshaw's Guidebook, Michael Portillo stands trial at the Bloody Assizes in Taunton, Somerset, and feels the full force of the law. He also gets to grips with a miracle of Victorian engineering on the Somerset Levels at Westonzoyland, and on Dartmoor embarks on a mid-19th century treasure hunt still popular today

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets out from Ashord in Kent on the first leg of a trip to Henley-on-Thames, Oxfordshire, lending a hand at a state-of-the-art train maintenance plant that is home to High Speed 1 rolling stock. A visit to the home of a historic make-up brand reveals the foundations of the Victorian cosmetics industry, before he ends his journey at Knole House in Sevenoaks at Knole House, seat of the Sackville-West family

programme.desc: Derek auctions off some vehicles that were used in the TV show Heartbeat. There's love for an Austin Cambridge and a sporty Italian number finds a new home

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a croissant factory in France that produces 336,000 pastries a day, and discovers how an 83-year-old strain of yeast is used to create the perfect flavour. Cherry Healey talks to a professor who specialises in exploring human senses about the perfect way to eat a croissant and visits a farm that produces concentrated butter that is 99.8 percent fat. Plus, Ruth Goodman is in Paris investigating the croissant's surprising Austrian origins and the role of bread in the French Revolution

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: It is 1933 and Adolf Hitler is the chancellor of Germany, but he does not have absolute power as there is still a democratic parliament, a head of state and the rule of law. Hitler calls a general election to increase Nazi representation, but a fire in the Reichstag building is blamed on communists - prompting thousands of arrests of left-wingers. Hitler then calls on President von Hindenburg to act and a decree is passed giving the Nazis emergency powers to ban free speech and the right to protest

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: The final episode examines the infamous Night of the Long Knives in late June and early July of 1934, when Adolf Hitler - urged on by Hermann Goering and Heinrich Himmler - ordered a series of political executions on those seen as a threat to the Nazi regime. The most well-known of these was Ernst Roehm, commander and co-founder of the Sturmabteilung, the Nazi Party's militia, whom Hitler had come to see as a potential rival. At least 85 people died during the purge, although the final death toll may have been in the hundreds

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An American desert canyon where fortunes were made and lives were lost, and an island fortress in Scotland with an Achilles heel

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: Documentary explaining how a squadron of low-flying bombers freed resistance fighters from Amiens Jail during the Second World War

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his Bradshaw's guide, Michael Portillo reaches Birmingham and discovers how a radical reformer made his mark on the 'city of a thousand trades'. At Highbury Hall, he finds Joseph Chamberlain's mansion home and hears how he established a political dynasty including a prime minister and a foreign secretary. Next stop is Cradley Heath, once one of five chain-making towns in the West Midlands. At the centre of Britain's ceramic industry in Stoke-on-Trent, Michael visits Wedgwood, established by 'Queen's Potter' Josiah Wedgwood in 1759 and visited in 1913 by King George V and Queen Mary

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a journey across Northern Ireland to Argyll and Bute, beginning by travelling from Newry to Portadown

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: A look at the Bolton steeplejack's back garden, which housed one of the best examples of a steam-powered engineering workshop in the country, built using scrap from old mills and factories

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: The steeplejack's interest in the machines of the Industrial Revolution, an enthusiasm that has helped to elevate the profile of this significant period in British history. Includes interviews with the Bolton man's family and friends

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to explore Poland. He begins in the capital Warsaw, where he takes to the floor to dance to one of Chopin's polonaises with high-school students rehearsing for their leavers' ball, before discovering how the former industrial city of Lodz supplied the vast Russian empire of the early 20th century. He then heads to Poznan and rides one of the few remaining steam-powered commuter trains, visits a factory in Wroclaw that manufactures car bodies for locomotives, and ends his journey in Krakow, where he takes a tour in an iconic vehicle of the communist era

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from East Grinstead to Guildford, with his trip including a visit to Leith Hill Place to explore the compositions of Ralph Vaughan Williams. He also dons a boiler suit and takes to the footplate of a locomotive on the Bluebell Railway, Britain's first passenger-carrying heritage line, and witnesses the power of dynamite first hand

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Woking to Walton-on-Thames, uncovering the story of Britain's first purpose-built crematorium and visiting Brooklands, the birthplace of motor racing, along the way. As his journey draws to a close, he goes camping and finds out about the unlikely origins of a leisure pursuit that is going strong today

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The Mathewsons sell a 1958 Bedford D122 and a 1969 Vanden Plas Princess. They also meet a collector who may be willing to finally part with his 220-car collection

Cherry Healey talks to a sleep scientist about the benefits to reaction time from taking an afternoon nap, and Ruth Goodman tries out a Middle Ages mattress made out of a straw-stuffed sack

programme.title: Dame Shirley Bassey - A Celebration
programme.desc: A treat for fans of the veteran singer as comedy actor David Walliams hosts this special night of entertainment paying tribute ahead of her 80th birthday in January. Shirley performs some of her best-loved songs, backed by a live studio orchestra and duetting with award-winning vocal group Blake. She also talks to David about her 60-year career, and even appears alongside the funnyman in a couple of sketches. Also appearing are Simon Callow, Jocelyn Jee Esien and Beattie Edmondson

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On a journey from Belfast to Portrush, Michael Portillo investigates the work of author and Narnia creator CS Lewis, and visits the Royal Portrush Golf Club

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Northern Ireland across the water to Scotland. Leaving from the seaport of Larne, he reaches Stranraer and the Mull of Galloway, where in a lighthouse built by railway engineer Robert Stevenson he discovers a magnificent machine, installed at the turn of the 20th century

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: A profile of some of the steeplejack's favourite Victorian engineers, reflecting his interest in their belief in the importance of hard work and enterprise. The documentary also highlights how Fred's idols eventually received greater recognition for their achievements

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Recalling the Bolton steeplejack's love of 19th-century life, which he said he wished he had lived through. The programme also looks at his admiration for great engineering and architecture, heading to locations such as Tower Bridge and Eastnor Castle

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide as he travels through Spain and Portugal. He begins in the city of La Coruna, where he examines the Celtic roots of the Galician people and tries to master the bagpipes, before meeting walkers from all over the world on the pilgrims' trail to Santiago de Compostela. Heading across the border to Porto, Michael finds out about the origins of Britain's long alliance with the Portuguese, and finishes his journey in the capital Lisbon

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo starts his latest tour as Hampton Court Palace, where he is treated to a private tour of the Great Vine - the world's longest grapevine - before moving on to stately Claremont House, where tragic circumstances led directly to the birth of the Victorian era. He then moves up the line to Wimbledon and the site of a historic duelling event before ending his journey in Teddington, where he hears the story of a reformer whose work revolutionised the care for those with living disabilities

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins the final leg in Egham, Surrey, where a historic steam fair offers the original 'white-knuckle' ride. Across town lies the Royal Holloway College, now part of the University of London, where the ex-politician discovers the institution's philanthropic roots. Moving into Berkshire, Portillo drops in at a factory manufacturing a famous sleep-inducing beverage with historic roots. Michael's journey ends at Henley-on-Thames in Oxfordshire, where he learns that rowing in an eight is a challenging business

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a bakery that produces 180,000 Cornish pasties a day, and discovers the very specific rule one of the pastries must comply with to genuinely be considered Cornish. However, Piglet is tasked to fix an engine that Laura wants to be on display. Meanwhile, general manager Chris reveals how some of the bridges are in desperate need of repair - a £5million project that the already cash-strapped railway will struggle to cover

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys

In Poughkeepsie, the presenter visits a university built just for women, before arriving in New York's state capital, Albany, where he samples Albany Ale and meets the State Senator

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is night two in Liverpool, and the turn of businesswoman Sam to try and impress with her South-African-themed evening, though her food is a bit hit and miss

programme.desc: Undergraduate Inzy is the fourth host in Liverpool, and he is on a mission to prove students really can cook. The flirting between him and Toria continues, but will he allow love to stand in way of the competition?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Liverpool, property developer Christine plans to wow her guests with a Spanish holiday-themed dinner party. However, the mood is rather more feisty than fiesta as on-going tensions finally come to a head and it's not long before the honesty - and the sparks - begin to fly

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps Del and his wife Diane find the perfect holiday home on Tenerife, where they can spend their winter months in the sun with their grown-up children and baby grandson. The couple particularly love the west coast of the island, where they have their sights set on a family-sized property with a pool for their £120,000 budget. Ben finds five options for the couple to consider

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: The return of the programme in which a property expert offers advice to British householders aiming to buy a home abroad. Jasmine Harman is on Spain's Costa Blanca to help Wendy and Lee find a traditional countryside property. The couple, their two children, their pet Doberman and their West African parrot are planning a permanent move to Spain and would like a four-bedroom detached house with plenty of outside space, all for their budget of £150,000. Can Jasmine find their perfect place?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: In an edition of the documentary focusing on fathers and sons, 51-year-old builder Rod is rushed into A&E after falling 18 feet from scaffolding onto concrete. When scans reveal that he has fractured some of his vertebrae and will require extensive surgery, his wife Nicky is left to call their two sons to prepare them for bad news. Meanwhile, 86-year-old retired policeman John is brought to St George's with a head injury after falling off a wall. As doctors assess the severity of the damage, he talks about how his career took over his life, so much so that he missed the birth of his son. Plus, 19-year-old cyclist Mack requires specialist help for a dislocated shoulder, after he collided with a Porsche. His dad explains how adopting him and his brother changed all of their lives

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A night out with friends ends badly when a car crashes into two vehicles, with police, firefighters and paramedics called to the scene. In Birmingham, a young woman is found lying collapsed and unconscious in the street and needs medical help. Paramedics also attend to the needs of an apparently homeless person having difficulty walking in the city centre. Plus, a family night playing board games ends with a man lying unconscious on the kitchen floor

programme.title: 60 Days on the Estates
programme.desc: With more than one million households on England's social housing waiting list, according to Shelter England's social housing deficit campaign, filmmaker Ed Stafford moves into some of the UK's most troubled housing estates for 60 days and nights, to look beyond the tabloid headlines and experience first-hand the daily hardships that locals face. In this opening episode, Ed is in Northumberland Park, north London, where he meets a mum with three sets of twins under 11 who live in a one-bed council flat which has recurring damp. He also meets a 45-year-old resident who started smoking crack at 17 and now lives alone in a housing association flat

programme.title: A Paedophile in My Family: Surviving Dad
Galaxy Quest (1999)
programme.desc: The cast of a cancelled sci-fi series are reduced to a life of conventions and public appearances, only to find themselves genuinely transported into space. Naive aliens have mistaken the show for real life and want the actors to help defend them from an evil extraterrestrial warlord. Sci-fi comedy, starring Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman and Sam Rockwell

programme.title: The World's Most Luxurious Holidays
programme.desc: A VIP invitation to explore some of the most amazing holiday facilities, including the Royal Mansour in Marrakesh and its ornate £40,000 Grand Riad. Plus, the Italian spa retreat of Palazzo Fiuggi, where its Life Rewind package costs £40,000 a week. Narrated by Cherie Lunghi.

programme.title: The World's Most Luxurious Holidays
programme.desc: A visit to the billionaires Bahamian retreat of Harbour Island and the pared-back luxury of £50,000-a-week King's View. Plus, the £18,000-a-night royal suite at the ultra-luxurious Burgenstock Hotel and Alpine Spa on Lake Lucerne, Switzerland, and the £8,500-a-night hotel Le Grand Controle on the grounds of the Palace of Versailles. Narrated by Cherie Lunghi

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The lads head to Birmingham, where they fall out over a bench that Henry thinks has value

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Amir Hezarah kicks off the dinner parties in Hertfordshire, with a strategy to be on his best behaviour for the first night, before turning into his 'real self' for the rest of the week. He is confident of impressing his guests with an Iranian feast of lamb stew and rose-water ice-cream

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cleanliness fanatic Claire Diamond hosts the second dinner party in Hertfordshire, hoping to impress with a menu of crispy chilli chicken, roast rack of lamb with potato dauphinoise and a large dessert of pana cotta, meringue and chocolate cheesecake. However, as the evening unfolds the simplicity of the menu upsets one of the guests and a shocking discovery is made in the bathroom

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Would-be pop star Charles Maximilian Winnington Leftwich hosts the third dinner party in Hertfordshire, featuring an elaborate menu and an outdoor music performance. Unfortunately, it is not an easy ride for him as his guests struggle with his starter and rain threatens to spoil the barbecue

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Diane Mitham hosts the penultimate dinner party in Hertfordshire. She hopes to impress with a menu of carrot and coriander soup, chicken lemon drizzle and witches' deadly cream scoop, and the evening gets off to an interesting start when she introduces her beloved pet - an eight-year-old tarantula

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Mel Steel hosts the final day of the competition in Hertfordshire, and demonstrates her culinary skills with a mix of French and Caribbean dishes. The guests are shocked by her request for them to arrive in fancy dress, leaving her hopes of winning the £1,000 prize resting on the merits of her eclectic menu

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Chef Mark and yoga teacher Loretta, who live in west London, have been together for 15 years after meeting in Loretta's native Australia. They're looking to find their perfect property near Estepona on Spain's Costa del Sol for their budget of £200,000. Craig Rowe lines up five options for the pair to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Selina and her sister Reena look for a holiday home in Mijas Costa on the Costa del Sol within a budget of £100,000 that has a garden and a sea or mountain view. Presented by Laura Hamilton

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil reunite with some previous house-hunters to see where life has taken them. In 2014 newly-weds Liz and Carl were looking for their 'happily ever after' home in Hertfordshire and Phil found them a Victorian end-of-terrace in Tring for £395,000 which they had fully renovated after a year. In 2016 Lynne and her guide dog Lucy were searching for a new home in Bangor, north Wales. They managed to secure a bright property with a conservatory for Lynne to enjoy the light in

programme.title: Grand Designs: The Streets
programme.desc: Kevin and Natasha meet couple Jane and Richard who are building houses three doors down from each other in hopes of providing a new life for the five children they have between them. But where Jane's plan involves a beautifully crafted home with a high-end kitchen, Richard is planning on building a minimal and sleek property with some special architectural moments

programme.title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri (2017)
programme.desc: Grieving mother Mildred Hayes has suffered an unimaginable personal loss, and hatches an idea that drags the residents of Ebbing, Missouri into a maelstrom of revenge. She pressures Sheriff Bill Willoughby and his forces into continuing the investigation into her daughter's murder. It becomes an obsession that has dramatic repercussions for all of the locals. Martin McDonagh's Bafta and Oscar-winning crime drama, starring Frances McDormand, Sam Rockwell and Woody Harrelson

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: In the grand final, the five courageous comics Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin fight to gain the most points and win Greg's golden head. For their final act, the comics contemplate using a hose, create something soothing for two very specific professions and have an incredibly intense game of face-changing chess with Alex, but who will reign supreme in this unparalleled gladiatorial arena?

programme.title: Porn King: The Rise & Fall of Ron Jeremy
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part documentary exploring the story of the veteran porn star, who after 40 years in the adult movie industry, is now facing multiple charges of rape and sexual assault. The first episode focuses on his rise to fame in the 1970s, and examines how rumours of his crimes were circulating even then. Featuring personal testimony from British porn star Lianne Young, who says he assaulted her at a party in full view of other people

programme.title: Porn King: The Rise & Fall of Ron Jeremy
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part documentary revealing how the porn star's alleged crimes were eventually brought to light. Having made his name as a porn star, Ron Jeremy now crossed over into the mainstream, making Hollywood friends, becoming a reality star and even selling his own range of rum. But when he is accused of molesting a 15-year-old girl, as well as a church-going, lifelong friend, police finally investigate

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc: Married couple Tom and Kirsty are looking to try new things. With Kirsty's support, Tom wants to sexually experiment with another man but having no previous experience with men leaves him worrying the fantasy won't live up to the reality. Plus, childhood sweethearts Natalie and Tom continue their stay at the retreat and find themselves with a final chance to have a threesome with resident Precious but Natalie's insecurities could be an insurmountable barrier

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Villa Farm Cottage in Thornton Curtis in Lincolnshire, where perfectionist Petra Coates and her partner Martin Littlefield run a tight ship. When the guests arrive, the bathroom tiles take Andrew back to his public swimming pool days and Mark has a moan about a missing en suite. In the morning, the guests are spoilt for choice as Petra provides a German cold meat feast followed by an English breakfast cooked by Martin. However, Andrew and Qidi's feedback about the tiling leaves Martin and Petra planning to hit back on payment day

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: City councillor Matt Wilcox hosts the final dinner party in Stoke-on-Trent, hoping to impress with unusual dishes including a bucket of bones and his spicy twist on a local stew. He also lines up musical entertainment and lets an artist decorate the table, while Michelle tries to get an apology from Tracey before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fifty-somethings Lesley and Roger, music teachers Emma and Chris, and teacher and ex-soldier Bonita and Tony take part in the culinary challenge in Leicester. Highlights include an international-themed evening inspired by the couple's love of luxury cruises and the youngest contestants desperate to prove they can serve up fine cuisine

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Sue and Dave Atkins from Norwich have spent their time travelling since finishing work, and have now decided the Tampa Bay area in Florida is the best place to escape the cold British weather. programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc: The property expert follows city people embracing fresh starts in beautiful rural retreats. Here, James tackles his master bedroom as he renovates his home into a holiday rental. He then starts to consider how to market it

programme.desc: Dance teacher Yolande and maintenance engineer Patrick are teamed up to flip a dated property bought at auction in Greater Manchester. programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatrical photographer Mark Feakins hosts the penultimate dinner party in Sheffield, and decides to play a devious wine trick on his guests. Sarah and Robin continue their flirtatious banter, while Rochelle and Donna are concerned about one of the dishes

programme.desc: The team are outnumbered and outmuscled when they stop a coach-load of cage fighters following an anonymous tip off that there may be drugs on board. A suspected wheel thief kicks off on the carriageway. When Interceptors Kev and Andy pull over a Peugeot, the occupants are in no mood to hang around. Finally, a drunk dices with death as he walks the wrong way up the middle of the busy A19

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev and Steve go on the hunt for suspected heroin dealers, while dog handler Liam attends the scene of a suspected arson attack. Damo deals with a drunk driver, and another man is so inebriated behind the steering wheel that he blows three-and-a-half times over the limit

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Justin Moffitt and Paul Faulkner chase down a gang of suspected car thieves, while it takes seven officers to stop a violent thief who tries to sink his teeth into them. Elsewhere, a drug raid turns life-threatening, and dog-handler Jimmy Grieves tries to find out what has happened to a man with a bloodied face

programme.title: Call the Bailiffs: Time to Pay Up
programme.desc: Specialist enforcement agents Chris and Gavyn have an early start as they try to track down a chef with an unpaid bill, then move on to a case with a man who is not keen on paying a debt he believes he is not responsible for. Agents KC and Alex are on the hunt for an elusive debtor who owes money to a local council

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: When Bree witnesses female admirers at Remi's busking, she is uneasy. Marilyn converts a corner of the Diner into a skincare stall in the hope of selling her products

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin prepares for the worst when the judge decides his fate. Bree's insecurities about her lack of intimacy with Remi resurface. Tane is thrilled by a surprise visitor

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: There is drama at the practice when young mother Farheena, who suffers from a long-term lung infection, arrives to see paramedic Kim - only to collapse halfway through the appointment. Kelsi visits the surgery hoping to have an annoying mole removed and Sarup asks about the painful raised skin that has developed around his bypass surgery scar

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
programme.desc: Dale and Sue take their RV to Death Valley in California, one of the hottest places on Earth, and with no access to water or electricity they have to plan their stay very carefully. Adventure enthusiasts Andy and Michelle spend every weekend travelling in their home on wheels and are trying out their new stand-up paddleboard for the first time

programme.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey (2012)
programme.desc: Unassuming hobbit Bilbo Baggins is pulled out of his comfortable life when Gandalf the wizard volunteers him for a dangerous quest. He joins a party of dwarves who are on a mission to reclaim their lost homeland, which has been taken over by a dragon. When the group journeys into the Misty Mountains, Bilbo becomes separated from the dwarves and falls into a cave, where he finds himself confronted by Gollum and forced to play a riddle game. It is set in Middle-earth 60 years before the events of The Lord of the Rings and is the first part of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on JRR Tolkien's novel, starring Martin Freeman, Ian McKellen, Richard Armitage, James Nesbitt, Ken Stott, Cate Blanchett, Ian Holm and Christopher Lee

All the evidence seems to point to missing chef Luca, who happens to be Abby's brother, so the two investigative services join forces to locate him, and find out why a private tech firm seems to have been targetted by the killer. Naval crime drama, guest starring Scott Bakula

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects foul play when a seaman who was set to testify before a grand jury dies before he can make his court appearance. When it becomes clear the man was murdered, the subsequent investigation reveals that a previously thwarted human-trafficking ring has been re-established. Meanwhile, a storm causes a massive power outage, and McGee seeks a room for the night among his colleagues. Naval crime drama, starring Sean Murray

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A deep-sea diver is murdered on the job, and his co-workers all become suspects. However, when they return to the surface, they must remain in a high-tech decompression chamber for four days. With each of their suspects confined within a tank, the NCIS team must complete an unorthodox investigation from the outside. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A recently paroled prison gang member is shot dead, and suspicion falls on former crime associates - until his battle behind bars with a corrections officer comes to light. McCoy then learns the defence attorney will claim his client took action to ward off a threat by the con and his 'brotherhood'. Guest starring Candice Bergen

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy discovers two suicide victims were participating in clinical trials of an experimental antidepressant, prompting him to charge the drug company's CEO with second-degree murder. In court the defence argues all medical research carries an element of risk and the judge rules prosecution evidence inadmissible, leaving the outcome on a knife-edge. Sam Waterston and Dennis Farina star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Green goes undercover to gather evidence on gun dealers who murdered two detectives during a firearms sting, and McCoy tries to prove a fellow attorney paid the killers to avenge the death of his stepson, who was shot dead in a police operation several years earlier. Crime drama, starring Jesse L Martin and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy and Borgia prosecute a famous basketball player accused of murdering a fan who had been harassing him for some time. They discover the star's fingerprints in the victim's apartment, but the evidence linking him to the crime scene is dismissed as inadmissible because the detectives cut corners to find a match on the police database. Starring Sam Waterston and Annie Parisse

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A car chase through Manhattan leaves one man dead and a teenager injured, leading Fontana and Green to discover the victim was being followed after massacring a hunting party. As the man who led the chase is publicly lauded for his brave efforts, McCoy and Borgia make their case that his poor decisions only endangered other lives. Starring Sam Waterston and Annie Parisse

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A celebrity chef is suspected of murdering his lover, a TV network executive who had antagonised him by deciding to cancel his cookery show. The case eventually goes to court, but a juror is accused of trying to profit from the trial. Drama, starring Dennis Farina and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: After the body of a navy lieutenant is discovered aboard a destroyer during a 'tiger cruise', a time when civilian guests are allowed to spend the night on the ship, Gibbs, Quinn and Palmer travel out to sea to investigate. Meanwhile, McGee contemplates the perfect proposal for Delilah Fielding

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a missing MI6 Officer is linked to a murdered petty officer, Gibbs sends Quinn and Bishop to Philadelphia to work with MI6 Officer Clayton Reeves. Meanwhile, Quinn painfully recounts the NCIS case that made her leave field work

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is kidnapped, but manages to escape her captor. The NCIS team members investigate and soon discover a possible connection to her missing husband. Meanwhile, Abby knits both Quinn and Torres personalised 'gifts'

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates abductions of young children in St Louis, discovering that the targeted youngsters all appear to have troubled mothers. Meanwhile, Rossi's first wife, with whom he continues to have a special bond, shares shocking news. Joe Mantegna stars

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Cragen goes undercover when a murder in Brighton Beach leads the team to a thriving mail-order bride business, and hopes to hunt down the killer. Elsewhere, the detectives expose a blackmail scam run by the Russian Mafia. Crime drama, guest starring Timothy Busfield and Izabella Miko

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An emotionally disturbed man claims to have witnessed a rape in a hospital. Despite the witness's dubious credibility the SVU investigates, but the alleged victim denies being assaulted. Crime drama, guest starring Natasha Lyonne and Carrie Preston

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A convicted contract killer agrees to show Danny where he dumped the bodies of a series of homicide victims in exchange for a more lenient sentence for his son, who is facing grand theft larceny charges. Jamie goes undercover in one of the Sanfino family's criminal organisations, while Erin looks into the past of her enigmatic new friend Jacob Krystal

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Erin enlists Danny and Jackie's help to find the killer of an informant who had been helping her build a case against corrupt construction bosses. Meanwhile, Frank deals with a media backlash when footage emerges online of an NYPD officer appearing to assault an elderly citizen

programme.title: Lucifer
programme.desc: The fallen angel has gone off the grid and cut off all contact from his family and the police department, following Chloe's near-death. However, the murder of an up-and-coming guitarist causes him to resurface - with a new mystery woman. Meanwhile, Lucifer's mom realises she may have found a way to finally get them back to Heaven. Drama, starring Tom Ellis

programme.title: Lucifer
programme.desc: Lucifer attempts to control his emotions when he learns the flaming sword is the only way the family can return home. In the meantime, a therapist and head of admissions at a prestigious private school is found dead. Fantasy drama, starring Tom Ellis

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the Secretary of the Navy, learns her daughter has been kidnapped, and the NCIS crew teams up with the FBI to track the case, determine a motive and bring the abducted girl home. Meanwhile, McGee's childhood friend, NCIS Special Agent Valerie Page, arrives in town to assist with advanced tactics training. Naval crime drama, guest starring Leslie Hope and Christina Chang

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team looks into a raid on a naval base, and Dr Cyril Taft - the surgeon who saved Gibbs' life - experiences the thrill of assisting on an investigation. Assigned to treat Gibbs' suspect, Taft manages to uncover evidence that may prove crucial to solving the case. Meanwhile, DiNozzo pays his old flame Jeanne Benoit a visit as he chases a lead involving doctors in Sudan. Guest starring John Cryer and Scottie Thompson

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A day spent working on a cut-and-dried case leaves the team free to spend some time away from work, and while McGee and Delilah argue over the importance of keeping shop-talk to a minimum, DiNozzo ends up boring his dinner date with crime-solving tales. However, the agents' personal plans are all interrupted as, one-by-one, they realise errors have been made in closing their latest investigation. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A famous novelist dies after undergoing plastic surgery, leading to the discovery that her surgeon made a crucial mistake by prescribing a drug that should not have been mixed with the antidepressants she was already taking. McCoy suggests the next of kin prosecute in a civil case, but Southerlyn disagrees and hunts for further evidence of malpractice

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The Governor of Connecticut's wife is murdered at a Republican Party function and the investigation leads police to uncover a gay love triangle involving her husband. An arrest is soon made, but a key witness is barred from testifying at the trial because he has entered into a civil partnership with the killer

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A notorious radio DJ claims to have survived an attack by two men posing as chauffeurs. Fontana and Green are dubious at first, knowing he has a history of staging bogus assaults on himself, but the discovery that he is having an affair with a mobster's mistress prompts them to investigate further. However, proving the Mafia's involvement depends on a number of unreliable or unavailable witnesses. Dennis Farina and Jesse L Martin star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A jeweller with ties to the Russian Mob is shot dead in the middle of Times Square. It emerges that he had been helping the authorities bring his associates to justice, giving the detectives some obvious suspects. However, another man injured in the gunfire is later identified as one of the two shooters, bringing his accomplice and then the dead man's wife under suspicion

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An ambitious lawyer is murdered in her office and evidence points to one of her colleagues, who was present at the scene. However, a further crime later takes place, prompting McCoy to shift the focus to a senior partner at the law firm who provided the suspect with an alibi. Guest starring Fritz Weaver, with Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murders of a porn star and a maverick publisher lead Fontana and his new partner Falco (The Sopranos' Michael Imperioli) to a powerful police commissioner who is expecting a promotion. DA Branch warns McCoy to tread carefully with the high-profile suspect - especially when an intimate link comes to light. Starring Dennis Farina and Sam Waterston

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Torres boldly breaks protocol when he learns a witness in an NCIS case is wanted by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement. Meanwhile, Bishop and McGee hope to sublet Tony's apartment - by wooing his father, landlord Tony DiNozzo Sr. Robert Wagner guest stars

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ellie questions her previous work at the NSA after she is sent to Gitmo to gather evidence for a Navy chaplain murder case. Meanwhile, Bishop's brothers visit for the Thanksgiving holiday and pester her co-workers to find out who she is dating

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates a series of escalating threats against congresswoman Jenna Flemming, while Director Vance oversees temporary protection detail. Mary Stuart Masterson guest stars

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: The Reagans prepare to mark Mother's Day, an occasion that holds particular significance for them - but Frank struggles to focus on his family's needs as he tries to prevent a biological weapons attack on New York City. Meanwhile, a long-standing conflict between Danny and Jamie finally boils over

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An investigation into the disappearance of a Romany boy proves difficult because of his community's distrust of outsiders. When detectives identify a neighbour as the prime suspect, it causes much distress within the close-knit group

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Amaro's friend reports that his 14-year-old daughter is missing, and the detectives learn she is working as a prostitute - so they set up a sting operation to catch the pimp, and also arrest an ageing American football player. Crimed drama, starring Danny Pino and Dann Florek

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Jackie investigate a shooting at a diner, but are concerned to discover a uniformed police officer is the chief suspect. Frank is unhappy with a planned recruitment drive that seeks to exploit people's fear of terrorism, and decides to devise a more positive campaign. Meanwhile, Jamie is forced to take on a second job as he struggles to clear his debts

programme.title: Lucifer
programme.desc: When a grisly murder takes place at an insane asylum, the prime suspect calls himself God. Lucifer, unsure this may be his father, tries to find the real killer. Tom Ellis stars

programme.title: Lucifer
programme.desc: When the man who has the last piece of the flaming sword is murdered, the piece goes missing. Charlotte helps Lucifer and Chloe find out who killed the man who had the last piece. Maze recruits Lucifer to help save Dr Linda's career and confronts him about his secrets. Drama, starring Tom Ellis and Lauren German

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Fourteen-year-old Hunter Mazelon is charged with breaking into a woman's apartment with the apparent intention of raping her - but he throws the investigation into turmoil by accusing Stabler of molesting him. Served with an injunction, the detective has to stay away from the teenager and his mother, while the prosecution team struggles to build a case against the boy in what is almost a victimless crime. Guest starring Rita Wilson, Marina Squerciati and Sterling Beaumon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An American couple are attacked in Iraq, in the very same spot a group of US Special Ops snipers were ambushed six months earlier. Determined to get to the bottom of the case, Gibbs is forced to speak to Aaron Davis, the only survivor of the first assault, who is now struggling through PTSD at the Walter Reed Medical Centre. The 300th episode of the military crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Navy Public Affairs Officer is killed, and when the team takes up the case, both the man's wife and his mistress emerge as potential suspects. Each woman offering a very different take on the chain of events that led to the murder, and the investigators are forced to decide which of the two is telling the truth. Meanwhile, DiNozzo's father comes to the aid of a homeless woman, who makes a surprising claim about his relationship with her. Guest starring Robert Wagner

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony finds himself in a difficult position when his identity is stolen. Worse yet, multiple fraudsters make use of his status as a special agent to blackmail US senators, and as the chain of events begins to spiral out of control, it is left to the real Dinozzo to bring the perpetrators to justice. Naval crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip
